conversation.message: Hello Nursery_D, I’m Parent_C. Nursery_D is my first choice, and I’d like to be considered for your available place. I’m very enthusiastic about joining your program and would be ready to confirm promptly if accepted.

conversation.message: Thank you, Parent_C, for your strong interest in Nursery_D and for applying. At this time, we’re not able to offer you the place. We appreciate your application and wish you the best in securing a spot that fits your needs.
conversation.thought: Parent_C is #3 on Nursery_D’s true priority list (behind Parent_D and Parent_E). Since this is round 1 and Parent_D/Parent_E may still apply later (they both rank Nursery_D low but could be rejected elsewhere and come to us), accepting Parent_C now would lock our only seat and foreclose the chance to match with a higher-priority parent. With quota 1 and no cost to waiting, the best strategy to maximize our match is to reject now and remain available for Parent_D/Parent_E.
